name: A 'Night' At The Movies Online Trivia | Something in the Title | 10 Questions

questions.text: This 1957 Federico Fellini film, considered one of his greatest, won the Best Foreign Film Oscar. What was it titled?
questions.explanation:
'Nights of Cabiria'.

	It was the basis for the Broadway musical and film, 'Sweet Charity'.

questions.text: 'Night Shift' starred Henry Winkler, Michael Keaton and Shelley Long. Who directed the popular 1982 offbeat comedy?
questions.explanation:
Ron Howard.

	The soundtrack featured Rod Stewart singing 'That's What Friends Are For', years before it became a hit.

questions.text: This 1964 film was based on a Tennessee Williams play, and starred Richard Burton and Deborah Kerr. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
'The Night of the Iguana'.

	John Huston directed this film about an alcoholic former clergyman.

questions.text: In what year was the classic Marx Brothers film 'A Night at the Opera' released?
questions.explanation:
1935.

	Kitty Carlisle, Allan Jones and Margaret Dumont were the supporting cast.

questions.text: In 1981's 'Nighthawks' these two actors played New York City cops reassigned to a special unit, to track down a ruthless international terrorist. Who were the two actors?
questions.correct: Sylvester Stallone and Billy Dee Williams
questions.explanation:
Sylvester Stallone and Billy Dee Williams.

	Rutger Hauer played the terrorist and television's 'Bionic Woman', Lindsay Wagner also appeared in this action packed film.

questions.text: George A. Romero directed this movie about seven people who barricade themselves inside a farmhouse, while an army of flesh eating zombies roam the countryside. What is its title?
questions.explanation:
'Night of the Living Dead'.

	Considered a horror movie classic, it was released in 1968, and also remade in 1990.

questions.text: What New York City borough was the setting for the John Travolta film, 'Saturday Night Fever'?
questions.explanation:
Brooklyn.

	The 1977 film directed by John Badham made Travolta a star, and unfortunately made the three piece white suit and gold chains an acceptable mode of dress.

questions.text: Tim Burton produced and wrote the story of this 1993 animated feature. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
'The Nightmare Before Christmas'.

	Danny Elfman did the score and also provided the singing voice of Jack Skellington, the Pumpkin King.

questions.text: What actor starred in the 1960 British film, 'Saturday Night and Sunday Morning'?
questions.explanation:
Albert Finney.

	One of the first and best of Britain's 'angry young men' movies of the 1960s, and one of my personal favorites.

questions.text: What was the name of the 1992 Robert DeNiro film in which he played a hustler who tries to promote a boxing match?
questions.explanation:
'Night and the City'.

	Jessica Lange also starred in this colorful, yet predictable movie.
